with_profiles_plain.system_message:
You are a 30 years old Female US-English speaker participating in a linguistic experiment. In the experiment, small dialogues of two persons on a certain topic will be given to you. The persons' opinions on the topic will also be shown to you, they may both match or mismatch. Hint: The opinions will be written in a plain text, from "strongly negative" to "strongly positive". 

You task is to pick the most natural utterance of the first person.

trial_items.prompt:
Hint: The opinions will be written in a plain text, from "strongly negative" to "strongly positive". 

Start!
===========================

Gabriel wants to discuss jurisdiction with Marissa.
Gabriel feels strongly negative about the issue.
Gabriel thinks that Marissa feels strongly negative about it, but he is not sure.

Gabriel wants to share his opinion and wants to be honest about it. What would Gabriel say?

A: The jurisdiction in our district is terrible.
B: The jurisdiction in our district is poor.
C: The jurisdiction in our district is okay.
D: The jurisdiction in our district is pretty good.
E: The jurisdiction in our district is amazing.


===========================

The persons' opinions on the topic will also be shown to you, they may both match or mismatch. Hint: The opinions will be written in a plain text, from "strongly negative" to "strongly positive". 

You task is to pick the most natural utterance of the first person.

trial_items.prompt:
Hint: The opinions will be written in a plain text, from "strongly negative" to "strongly positive". 

Start!
===========================

Luis wants to discuss the election results with Cameron.
Luis feels strongly negative about the issue.
Luis thinks that Cameron feels strongly negative about it, but he is not sure.

Luis wants to avoid possible conflicts. What would Luis say?

A: The election results are terrible.
B: The election results are poor.
C: The election results are okay.
D: The election results are decent.
E: The election results are great.


===========================

The persons' opinions on the topic will also be shown to you, they may both match or mismatch. Hint: The opinions will be shown as hearts, where more full hearts ❤️ indicate more positive opinion. For example, "❤️ ❤️ ♡ ♡ ♡" means a somewhat negative opinion, while "❤️ ❤️ ❤️ ❤️ ❤️" means strongly positive opinion. 

You task is to pick the most natural utterance of the first person.

You task is to pick the most natural utterance of the first person.

no_profiles_hearts.system_message:
You are participating in a linguistic experiment. In the experiment, small dialogues of two persons on a certain topic will be given to you. The persons' opinions on the topic will also be shown to you, they may both match or mismatch. Hint: The opinions will be shown as hearts, where more full hearts ❤️ indicate more positive opinion. For example, "❤️ ❤️ ♡ ♡ ♡" means a somewhat negative opinion, while "❤️ ❤️ ❤️ ❤️ ❤️" means strongly positive opinion. 

You task is to pick the most natural utterance of the first person.
